### American Community Survey   
For this project we used data from the [American Community Survey (ACS)](https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs/data.html). The American Community Survey (ACS) is a yearly survey that covers a broad range of topics about social, economic, demographic, and housing characteristics of the U.S. population. In this project we used 5-year ACS estimates, where represents data that has been collected over time. This gives us increased statistical reliability of the data. The 5-year estimates are available at the tract and block group lebel.

### Arlington Open Data Portal 
Additionally, we used data from [Arlington County Open Data Portal](https://data.arlingtonva.us/). This data contained a variety of information from the parks, from park ameneties to general park location to park acerage.

### Corelogic
[Corelogic](https://www.corelogic.com/) data is proprietary property data which provides latitude/longitude level geographic data on residences in a given place. We use this data to measure types of residences and locations of residences near parks. This allows us to proxy coverage of coverage polygons.
